referralLink.title: Simple Arithematic questions on Multiplication
referralLink.description: Are you ready for DKT test? Try simulation test before you go for final test.

referralLink.title: Simple Arithematic questions on Substraction
referralLink.description: Government website for all informationunder one umbrella.

options: Slow down and continue through the road works zone.
Stop and then proceed if you think it is safe.
Stop your vehicle and follow the directions of the traffic controller.
questions.qn: If you are driving towards a road works zone and a traffic controller displays a stop sign you must -

options: Stop and wait for directions
Merge to the right and give way to other traffic.
Speed up to get in front of any cars traveling in the right hand lane.
questions.qn: If you are driving through a road work zone in the left hand lane and you see this sign you should -

options: Anywhere inside the windows but only if they are not tinted.
Anywhere including on the dashboard.
On the front and back of the exterior of the vehicle.
questions.qn: Where must L or P plates be displayed on a vehicle -

options: All of the letter L or P.
Only enough of the letter so it is clear whether it is an L or P.
Most of the letter.
questions.qn: When displaying L or P plates, how much of the letter must be clearly visible?-

options: No, they must give way to cars at all times when riding on the road.
No, they must always ride on the footpath.
Yes.
questions.qn: Do bicycle riders have the same rights and responsibilities as drivers and motorcycle riders?

options: Only vehicles carrying a disable person and displaying a mobility parking authority may park in this area.
Motorcyclists may park in this area.
Vehicles may park in this area for up to ten minutes.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Not drive beyond the sign.
Drive with caution.
Not pass another vehicle.
questions.qn: When you see this sign you should -

options: Drive carefully, roundabout ahead.
Turn left at next street.
Pass to the left of the sign.
questions.qn: This sign means you should -

options: One way traffic ahead.
All right lane traffic must turn right at the next intersection
Right lane traffic may turn right or go straight ahead at the next intersection.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: No turns permitted.
Traffic travels in each direction.
Double lane bridge ahead.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: You must give way to traffic on your right
You may turn to the right.
You must not turn to the right.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: You must not turn to the left or the right.
You must not turn to the left.
You must not turn to the right.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: All traffic must travel in the direction of the arrow.
Follow the arrow unless you are turning right
Road curves to the left ahead.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: One lane bridge ahead, slow down.
No left turn.
You may travel only in the direction in which the arrow is pointing.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: You can go faster than 60 km/h
You are not to exceed 60 km/h.
You are on Highway 60.
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Only vehicles carrying a disable person and displaying a mobility parking authority may park in this area.
Motorcyclists may park in this area.
Vehicles may park in this area for up to ten minutes.

Not pass another vehicle.

options: No turns permitted.

options: You must not turn to the left or the right.
You must not turn to the left.
You must not turn to the right.

options: All traffic must travel in the direction of the arrow.
Follow the arrow unless you are turning right

questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

If you are driving a bus, taxi, hire-car, heavy motor vehicle (over 13.9 tonnes Gross Vehicle Mass), or a vehicle with a dangerous load, it is an offence when the level of alcohol in your blood reaches -

options: Has no effect on your driving ability.
Improves your driving ability.
Will affect your reactions and judgement.
questions.qn: Having 1 or 2 alcoholic drinks before driving -

options: Drive, but avoid using freeways
Be aware that your abilities are decreased.
Spend more time than usual looking in the mirrors.
questions.qn: Even if you feel unaffected after drinking alcohol, you should -

options: It slows down how quickly your brain works.
It speeds your brain up so you can work better.
It makes you calm down and think more clearly.
questions.qn: Alcohol is a depressant. This means -

options: Stop, only if a red light camera is in use
Speed up to clear the intersection before the lights change to red.
Stop at the stop line unless you are so close that sudden or sharp braking might cause an accident.
questions.qn: What should you do when approaching traffic lights which change from green to yellow?

options: You should slow down and check if anyone is coming before turning left.
- If the lights are red you must first stop, then you may turn left if it is safe to do so.
You may turn left only if a green arrow is shown
questions.qn: What may you do at an intersection with traffic lights at which this sign is displayed?

options: Pull over and wait till it stops raining
Keep going at the same speed because that's how fast the signs tell you to drive.
Slow down to a speed that suits the conditions better.
questions.qn: You are driving in busy traffic in an 80 km/h zone. It begins to rain lightly. What should you do?

options: Speed up to a little bit over the speed limit, because everyone does it.
Decide your speed yourself, based on the speed limit and the conditions.
Follow the suggestions and keep up with the traffic.
questions.qn: You are driving in a 70 km/h zone, keeping to the limit. Several vehicles pass you. One of your passengers suggests you should keep up with the other traffic. What should you do?

options: You must not drive faster than 100 km/h.
You must drive faster than 100 km/h.
The sign applies to truck drivers only, cars can travel at any speed
questions.qn: What does this sign mean?

options: Padded instrument panels.
Safety door latches.
Seat belts.
questions.qn: The most effective device for protecting passengers when in an accident is -

options: Do not have to be used in the rear seat.
Save lives and prevent injury.
Are not necessary for good drivers.
questions.qn: Which one of the following statements is correct? Seat belts -

options: Check your seatbelt is back in place.
Check your mirrors and blind spots for pedestrians, bicycles or other vehicles.
Check your headlights are turned off.
questions.qn: Before getting out of your vehicle you must -

options: Drive around them so you don't hold up traffic.
Sound your horn to hurry them up.
Wait extra time to allow them to cross safely.
questions.qn: If elderly people or children are on a pedestrian crossing you will probably need to -

options: A
B
C
questions.qn: Which sign painted on the road tells you there is a pedestrian crossing ahead?

options: All vehicles must give way to vehicle O.
Vehicle O must give way only to vehicle R.
Vehicle O must give way to vehicles P, Q and R.
questions.qn: Vehicle O is at a STOP sign -

options: Vehicle P.
Vehicle O.
Neither vehicle.
questions.qn: If both vehicles P and O in the diagram are turning right, which vehicle is in the best position to turn left into the street marked 'X'?

options: Flash your headlights to warn oncoming traffic.
Keep to the left and slow down.
Increase your speed and sound your horn.
questions.qn: You are approaching the crest (top of a hill) on a narrow road, the safest procedure is to -

options: The other vehicle is going slower than you.
You are travelling at more than 80 km/h.
The other vehicle is turning right.
questions.qn: On a single laned road (as shown), you must always overtake another vehicle on its right except when -

options: Drive closer to the vehicle in front so they can see you better.
Use your hazard warning lights when overtaking another vehicle.
Leave a longer gap behind the vehicle in front.
questions.qn: At night you should -

options: Follow closer to other vehicles.
Slow down and use your low beam headlights and hazard warning lights to make your vehicle seen.
Put on your high beam lights.
questions.qn: When it is very foggy during the day or night and your vehicle has no fog lights, you should -
